title.bibl: History of the Scandinavians in the U.S. Vol. II. [Crime Statistics]

div.bibl: History of the Scandinavians in the U.S. Vol. II. [CRIME STATISTICS]

body.p: page 3. "In 1880 there were, according to the United States census, 58,609 "prisoners" in the country. In other words, one person in every 856 of the total population was a criminal. Ten years later the total number of culprits had increased to 82,329."
"In 1880, The English had one prisoner for every 456 inhabitants; the Canadians, one for 590; the Germans, one for 949; and the Scandinavians, one for 1,539."
